gov.usgs.anss.rtp

Class Reftek

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.rtp.Reftek
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class Reftek
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class encapsulates all of the status and configuration data for a single Reftek Unit. The class is normally created by the configuration pass. The ReftekClient then uses object of this class to update the status information from AD, AQ, DK, and US status query blocks. This run() method monitors for the status blocks to have been all updated since the last update and writes the DASSTATUS and SNW with the results.

      • terminate

      • getUnknown

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getUnknown()
        The unknown collects status messages that are not known to this software in loadSH. These messages are already logged, but user software can get the entire StringBuilder of them here. Best to call clearUnknown just after it. The size of the Unknown String builder is limited to 100000 character, it is then trimmed by 50,000.
        Returns:

      • doDASStatusString

        public java.lang.StringBuilder doDASStatusString()
        build the DASStatus string. Note: Massposition and temperatures fixed from (int) masspos*10+0.5 to (int) Math.round(masspos*10.) on Mar 3 2014 about 1800 UTC At that time only the first mass position was recorded.
        Returns:
        A dasstatus string

      • getTimeQuality

        public int getTimeQuality()
        The time quality is a SEED value 0-100 - return it based on the last lock time. The time quality is 100 - (current time - lastLockTime) in minutes(was seconds until 2017/11), if there is not last locked time, the return is constantly 90.
        Returns:
        Time quality based on last lock

      • loadSH

        public void loadSH(java.lang.String soh,
                   EdgeThread par)
        Load a DS record from a byte buffer of the raw data.
        Parameters:
        soh - String with the state of health from the Reftek 130.
        par - A place to log any problems/status
